entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued February 12 at 4:01PM AKST until February 13 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 3:38AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Arctic front to bring snow and gusty winds Sunday... Snow showers will develop along an arctic front which will quickly push east across the Interior Sunday and Sunday night. Winds will become gusty in snow squalls with the possibility of 10 to 20 mph gusts over the Fairbanks area and surrounding hills. Farther east, northwest winds will likely gust into the 30 mph

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 1:14AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Freezing Fog possible for portions of the Tennessee Valley overnight.. Clear skies, calm conditions, residual moisture from recent heavy rainfall, and temperatures falling to and below freezing could lead to the development of fog and freezing fog. Total snow accumulations of less than 0.5 inches, except 1 to 3 inches above 500 feet. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oregon and southwest Washington. * WHEN...From 10 PM Monday to 10 AM PST Tuesday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; Western Columbia River Gorge

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued February 12 at 1:24PM PST until February 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Large waves and hazardous surf conditions. Breakers of 20 to 25 feet. * WHERE...South Washington Coast. * WHEN...From noon Monday to 4 AM PST Tuesday.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued February 12 at 12:56PM MST until February 15 at 12:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches possible.
